author: jessepollak
content:
**Summary: we remain on track with 6 clients for devnet-3 next week; spec issues are resolved and EIP is moving to "Review" status**

Action items:

- <@862973562243252234> to merge #3093
- <@363800010518822915> to clarify #3099 in the spec
- Ansgar to close #5862
- <@862973562243252234> to work with Ramana to make the library configurable
- Georgios to run the big blocks test on Goerli today
- <@552133098075193354>  to ensure we have sentry nodes up and running today
- <@688748669268132001>  to share out the documentation for metrics configuration on Lodestar
- <@607055410104500244>  to share out the documentation for metrics configuration on Lighthouse
- <@203220829473996800> will work on the Hive testing next week to enable client swapping
- Alexey to open a PR for additional beacon nodes connected to Netheremind 
- Ansgar to add some rationale around managing risk of adversarial attacks on the mempool
- <@552133098075193354> to put together a hackMD for devnet-3 milestones including interop repo


Full notes here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/15EatedrJanNxBZGPVASvwq9xgbTs5UxjsDfjpM6ppSY/edit#

content: I think the big block tests will be ran by Georgios

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> Again, wanted to proactively make clear that I really appreciate what everybody is doing for this. And respect that everyone is very busy. And I may have thought that we‚Äôre later in the process than we are. And if I offended anyone with my tone in the call, I apologize, just care about this a lot and want it to succeed :)

author: hsiaowei
content:
Hey CL teams,

We just released CL spec tests for `v1.3.0-alpha.1-hotfix`: 
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/releases/tag/v1.3.0-alpha.1-hotfix

- It includes the `VERSIONED_HASH_VERSION_KZG` fix: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3123 (Thank <@425907307621122049> for finding this bug. üôè)
- It only changed files under `<minimal | mainnet>/eip4844/sanity`and `<minimal | mainnet>/eip4844/random` test vectors (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/commit/208a091a1f9033a751925a173afb036aa42bb78a)

author: timbeiko
content: On that note, if client teams have metrics that would allow us to capture the data listed here (https://notes.ethereum.org/lQ_75o64R9q8ddt3M9M3tg?view#Data-collection) but that aren't listed in Dapplion's doc, please add them üôÇ

author: protolambda
content: Note: I believe those spec tests may be broken due to an issue described in https://github.com/protolambda/remerkleable/issues/15 which is fixed by https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3123 (the issue announced on the call today, which will soon get a release).

author: terence0083
content: Looks like hww just released it, I'll try it again

author: hsiaowei
content:
Right, it's fixed in the latest test vector release.  https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1031999860997619843/1044691663647420417

since `VERSIONED_HASH_VERSION_KZG` is not used in SSZ objects directly, no SSZ static changes with this fix.

author: terence0083
content:
Yeah. I can confirm it's unrelated. 

The 4844 `ssz_static` spec test passes for Prysm. I forgot <@159152274659082240> had fixed a `merkleizeWithMixin` bug. With his great fix, everything passes

author: terence0083
content:
Hi <@415109946682769408> , the `upgrade_to_eip4844` spec test is not clear to me. Are we suppose to go from (1) `Bellatrix->EIP4844`  or (2) `Capella->EIP4844`. ?
(1) works except for `fork_next_epoch_with_block` where withdrawal root is non zero but pre state has zero withdrawal root
(2) doesn't work because pre state is always versioned Bellatrix

Looking at the spec, seems like (2) is expected

author: hsiaowei
content: You're right. It's (2) and one pyspec testing tool (not spec) change was missed during Capella rebase (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/a6c4b9ae9e609735d0d056a26799df7909b0c030/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/test/helpers/genesis.py#L63 should be `CAPELLA_FORK_VERSION`). I will fix it and make another pre-release üò≠ Thank you!
